intro: Gouldia pubescens, commonly known as the silky gouldia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and fragrant blooms. Gouldia pubescens is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
